title: Historical Stock Price Performance of Accenture PLC during Market Events

content.text: During the Great Recession, which lasted from 2007 to 2009, the global financial markets experienced a severe downturn. Accenture's stock price took a significant hit, dropping from around $46 in mid-2007 to a low of $23 in early 2009. This decline was primarily driven by a decrease in demand for consulting and technology services due to widespread economic turmoil.

In 2008, the global financial crisis caused by the collapse of Lehman Brothers had a substantial impact on Accenture's stock price. The stock experienced a sharp decline, reaching a low of $23 in March 2009. This drop was a result of investor panic and a general lack of confidence in the global economy.

The dot-com bubble burst, which occurred from 2000 to 2002, had a significant impact on Accenture's stock price. As many technology companies failed during this period, investors lost confidence in the sector. Accenture's stock price declined from around $40 in early 2000 to a low of $6 in mid-2002. This decline reflected the broader market sentiment and the bursting of the speculative bubble surrounding internet-based companies.

Following the global economic downturn caused by the COVID-19 pandemic in early 2020, Accenture's stock price displayed resilience and recovered swiftly. Accenture's stock price experienced a sharp decline in March 2020, reaching a low of around $137. However, as the markets started to recover, the stock rebounded strongly and reached new all-time highs. By late 2021, Accenture's stock price was trading above $340, reflecting investor confidence in the company's ability to navigate challenging market conditions.

During general market rallies, Accenture's stock price typically benefits from increased investor optimism and a positive economic outlook. For example, during the bull market of the late 1990s, Accenture's stock price experienced significant growth, reaching a peak of around $120 in early 2000. Similarly, during periods of economic expansion and bull markets, Accenture's stock price tends to perform well.

Accenture's stock price has been influenced by various market events throughout history. Crashes, such as the Great Recession and the dot-com bubble burst, led to significant declines in Accenture's stock price. However, the company has also shown resilience and the ability to recover during market recoveries, such as the post-COVID period. Overall, Accenture's stock price performance reflects broader market trends and investor sentiment.
